text.p: - The Union Treaty between Russia and Belarus to be signed in Moscow on April 2 has been prepared in secrecy and haste.
- The production of 20 new Tupolev-204 planes with foreign investments will be supported by Russia's government.
- Veterans of war in Chechnya are writing to Boris Yeltsin as their last hope to receive veterans' benefits.
- Capital flight from Russia last year was 10 times more than the amount of foreign investments.
- The Treaty with Belarus has highlighted differences between top figures in Russia's government.
- The work of Russia's commercial banks will be examined the next month, according to a State Taxation agency official.
- The question of the union between Russia and Belarus has caused a split in Russia's ruling circles.
- Bureaucrats of both republics and pro-western politicians are against the union of two state, says Sergei Shakhrai, the president's representative in the Constitutional Court.
- The aim of the campaign against signing a Union Treaty with Belarus is to fool the people and to exert pressure on President Boris Yeltsin.
- The first reader to discover true stories in today's edition of the paper will be awarded 2,000 000 roubles ($350), says the paper which is full of Fool's Day stories.
